column1: Some days after the marriage the Knight of the Fish said to his wife that he would like to look over the palace
column2: which was so extensive that it covered a league of ground. They inspected the place together
column3: and the task occupied them four days. On the fourth day they ascended the roof
column4: and the knight was struck with amazement at the prospect. Never had he seen anything like it
column5: nor ever could he have seen its equal
column6: even if he had visited all Spain and the Empire of Morocco as well. "What castle is that?" inquired the Knight of the Fish
column7: "which I see standing in the distance
column9: responded the princess, is the castle of Albastretch; it is enchanted
column10: and no one is able to undo the enchantment; and no one of all those who have gone to it has ever been known to return." The knight listened intently to this
column11: and as he was valiant and adventurous
column12: on the following morning he mounted his horse
column14: and set out for the castle.
